analysis: This SKILL.md file appears to be a legitimate PDF processing guide with no significant security risks. The content focuses on standard PDF manipulation operations using well-known Python libraries (pypdf, pdfplumber, reportlab) and command-line tools (qpdf, pdftk). All code examples show local file operations for reading, writing, merging, splitting, and processing PDF documents. There are no external network requests, credential access attempts, dynamic code execution patterns, or suspicious dependencies. The file operations are limited to standard PDF processing tasks without accessing sensitive system directories. This appears to be a comprehensive but safe reference for PDF manipulation tasks.
